ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 111 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 111 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: A great class, but SO MUCH work. You'll have weekly animation assignments, several 30-second assignments, and then spend the last half of the semester working on a longer project. This class is really what you make of it: if you put the time and effort in, you'll walk away with some incredible pieces. Don't let the work scare you off! Just be aware that it's there. Also Johannes is a wonderful professor!
If you like drawing, storytelling, film, computers - or anything else - TAKE IT!

Principles of Animation provides a great foundation and introduction to animation, but it by no means will make you an expert in the field. It provides a really good foundation and history to the early conceptions of animations as well as establishing the main principles for the art. It also has a good introduction to a set of programs that can be helpful in producing animations but will require a lot more time than the semester to master and be an expert in.
